channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fallen branch needs collecting., 1st July
item.description:
Weeks ago branches broke off from a tree 1meter away, on the street. One branch was taken by the collection team and the other branch was dumped at the library car park, blocking the accessible parking. Please collect

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooksbys Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety issue - Road markings outside medical building faded causing cars to park blocking emergency vehicle access, 1st July
item.description:
Along Albion road the road markings have faded so cars have been parked in no parking zones obstructing access including to the Albion Surgery. Ambulance and medical vehicles have been blocked in or unable to access the surgery car park. Several obstructing cars have been reported but the drivers have moved them eventually without caution. However although it is obvious they are blocking access to a medical building the road markings do not make it clear enough. This needs to be rectified urgently. I note there are other reports on the same road concerning this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public bin removal, 1st July
item.description:
It has been discussed with Sarah Rogers ( street adviser) and Rowshan Hannan ( councillor) since November 2024, to remove the bin at the top of Fingal Street as there is one outside Morleyâ€™s and this additional one at the top of the street is a magnet for rubbish dumping and fly tipping- no action to date. I am to liaise with Gary Heuerman and this site according to the above persons for action to occur
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fingal Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on intersection of Federation Rd and Shornells Way, 1st July
item.description:
Furniture (sofa, desk) alongside bags and baskets littering the street at the bottom of Shornells Way where it intersects with Federation Rd. This is a frequent fly tipping point. It needs monitoring to sanction those using it as a dump.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Federation Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
